statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: 2K SPORTS CLASSIC BENEFITING COACHES VS. CANCER

article.description: Carlton Fay scored 16 points to lead Southern Illinois to a 66-52 win over California University of Pennsylvania on Tuesday night.
article.headline: Fay nets double-double as SIU tops California, Pa.
article.linkText: SIU runs over California, Pa. in 2K Sports Classic
article.story: CARBONDALE, Ill. -- Carlton Fay scored 16 points to lead Southern Illinois to a 66-52 win over California University of Pennsylvania on Tuesday night. The matchup was a regional round of the 2K Sports College Hoops Classic supporting Coaches vs. Cancer. Fay had SIU's only double-double with 11 rebounds. Wesley Clemmons, with 10 points, was the only other Saluki to score in the double digits. Kevin Dillard came off the bench to score nine points and chip in 9 assists. The teams were tied 25-25 after the first half, but Southern Illinois surged through the second half, outscoring California, Pa. 41-27. SIU's bench pitched in 31 points. Jerial Nixon had a game-high 20 points for the Vulcans on 8-for-12 shooting. Julian Logan added 10 points and had seven rebounds. The Vulcans shot 40.9 percent from the floor, while the Salukis shot 41.3 percent.
